Wavelet Autoregressive Modeling (WARM)

Source: R/wavelet.R
simulate_warm.Rd

Simulates synthetic series by modeling each wavelet component with an ARIMA model, simulating each component forward, and summing across components. Optionally rescales simulated components to match the observed component variance.

Usage

simulate_warm(
  components = NULL,
  n = NULL,
  n_sim = 1000,
  seed = NULL,
  match_variance = TRUE,
  var_tol = 0.1,
  check_diagnostics = FALSE,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

components

Matrix, data.frame, or list of numeric vectors. Wavelet components, typically produced by extract_wavelet_components.

n

Integer. Length of each simulated series.

n_sim

Integer. Number of realizations to generate.

seed

Optional integer. Base RNG seed for reproducibility.

match_variance

Logical. If TRUE, rescales each simulated component to match the observed component standard deviation.

var_tol

Numeric in [0, 1]. Relative tolerance used to trigger variance rescaling.

check_diagnostics

Logical. If TRUE, runs simple ARIMA diagnostics and warns on issues.

verbose

Logical. If TRUE, emits informational logs (via logger::log_info when available).

Value

Numeric matrix of dimension n x n_sim. Each column is a simulated realization.
